{"step_by_step_thinking": "Dustless alginate is mentioned in Document [6] and Document [24]. Document [6] states that dustless alginates are manufactured to prevent inhalation of alginate particles, which may cause respiratory problems. The alginate particles are coated with glycol or glycerine to make them denser. Glycol and glycerine are types of dihydric alcohol. Therefore, dustless alginate is produced by coating with dihydric alcohol.", "answer_choice": "C. Coating with dihydric alcohol"}
